entries.meaning: (now rare) A person who lives in a mountainous area (often with the connotation that such people are outlaws or uncivilized). [from 16th c.]
A person who climbs mountains for sport or pleasure. [from 19th c.]
(obsolete) An animal or plant that is native to a mountainous area.
examples: This hardy race [of sheep] differ from our other breeds, not only in their dark complection and horns, but principally in the long coarse shagged wool which grows upon these mountaineers.

entries.meaning: A bird of the genus Oreonympha; also called the bearded mountaineer or eastern mountaineer

verbs.description: mountaineer (third-person singular simple present mountaineers, present participle mountaineering, simple past and past participle mountaineered)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To climb mountains; to climb using the techniques of a mountaineer.
examples: […]  they had returned in safety to Europe, and were now in Switzerland, where they were mountaineering with great vigour.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, figurative) To climb as if on a mountain.
